Computing the Fisher Information of CRNs using Deep Learning
  • »
  • Sources
  • View page source

Sources

AK15

David F Anderson and Thomas G Kurtz. Stochastic analysis of biochemical systems. Volume 674. Springer International Publishing, 2015.

CTS23a

CTSB. Controlling stochastic chemical reaction networks using policy search. arXiv preprint, 2023.

CTS23b

CTSB. Efficient fisher information computation and policy search in sampled stochastic chemical reaction networks through deep learning. ArXiv, 2023.

FM19

Zachary R Fox and Brian Munsky. The finite state projection based fisher information matrix approach to estimate information and optimize single-cell experiments. PLoS Computational Biology., 15:e1006365, 2019.

Gil76

Daniel T Gillespie. A general method for numerically simulating the stochastic time evolution of coupled chemical reactions. Journal of Computational Physics., 22:403–434, 1976.

GMK17

Ankit Gupta, Jan Mikelson, and Mustafa Khammash. A finite state projection algorithm for the stationary solution of the chemical master equation. The Journal of Chemical Physics., 147:154101, 2017.

SOG22

Augustinas Sukys, Kaan Ocal, and Ramon Grima. Approximating solutions of the chemical master equation using neural networks. iScience., 25:105010, 2022.

WR21

Ting Wang and Muruhan Rathinam. On the validity of the girsanov transformation method for sensitivity analysis of stochastic chemical reaction networks. Stochastics., 93:1227–1248, 2021.
